alert.note: Alert for San Miguel; Santa Fe; Taos (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 12:54PM MDT until August 29 at 4:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central and northeast New Mexico, including the following counties, in north central New Mexico, Rio Arriba, Santa Fe and Taos. In northeast New Mexico, Mora and San Miguel. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1254 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Santa Fe, Pecos, Tererro, Cowles, Hyde Memorial State Park, Rio En Medio in Santa Fe County, Tesuque, Glorieta, Canada De Los Alamos and Chupadero. - This includes the following highways... State Road 63 between Mile Markers 1 and 25. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 284 and 285...and between Mile Markers 294 and 307. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
